alert.note: Alert for Jefferson; St. Francois; Ste. Genevieve (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Saint Louis (Eastern Missouri and West Central Illinois)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued February 22 at 1:53PM CST until February 22 at 2:45PM CST by NWS Saint Louis
info.description: The National Weather Service in St Louis has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Southwestern Monroe County in southwestern Illinois... Western Randolph County in southwestern Illinois... Southeastern Jefferson County in east central Missouri... Ste. Genevieve County in southeastern Missouri... St. Francois County in southeastern Missouri... * Until 245 PM CST. * At 153 PM CST, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Crystal City to near Desloge to near Roselle, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Severe thunderstorms will be near... Weingarten and Rocky Ridge around 210 PM CST. Other locations in the path of these severe thunderstorms include Bloomsdale, Red Bud, Womac, Ste. Genevieve and St. Mary. This includes Interstate 55 in Missouri between exits 141 and 170. This also includes St. Joe State Park, Hawn State Park, Felix Valle House State Park, and Missouri Mines Historic Site. TORNADO...POSSIBLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 600 PM CST for southwestern Illinois...and southeastern and east central Missouri. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Intense thunderstorm lines can produce brief tornadoes and widespread significant wind damage. Although a tornado is not immediately likely, it is best to move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. These storms may cause serious injury and significant property damage. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 600 PM CST for southwestern Illinois...and southeastern and east central Missouri.
